solution.text:
Any expression is not a polynomial if it contains division by a variable.
Also a variable's exponents can only be 0,1,2,3,... etc. and can't have an infinite number of terms.
\(\frac 1{x^2+_{j}_x+_{k}_}\), contains division by a variable
\(\sqrt x + _{j}_=x^{\frac 12}+_{j}_\), exponent cannot be a fraction
\(_{k}_xy^{_{{-1*j}}_}\),exponent cannot be a negative number
\(x^{_{j}_}+x^{_{{j+k}}_}+x^{_{{j+2*k}}_}+x^{_{{j+3*k}}_}+x^{_{{j+4*k}}_}.......\infty \), cannot have infinite terms
